title: Good chalk script font?
content:
Hey can anyone help me find a chalk typeface that is not too childish and has a scriptwritten feel, like a menu-board in a restaurant?

like this one used here:

[http://www.harpercollins.com/harperimages/isbn/large/8/9780732290498.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803023929/http:/www.harpercollins.com/harperimages/isbn/large/8/9780732290498.jpg "http://www.harpercollins.com/harperimages/isbn/large/8/9780732290498.jpg")

thanks!
author: Sye

comments.content: Borrow a chalkboard and some chalk, write stuff, photograph it, use it!
And if Arnor's idea is way to low tech for you, Photoshop filters can produce the effect in your sample. I am pretty sure that is how that word was created.

Thanks guys - it's for a friend who does not want to have to write all the text out, and when looking through the book I believe it was hand done and scanned.

I remembered Fugu after posting the request and I think she may suggest it to the client, but thanks again for the help!

cheers
